# project general coding guidelines

### Naming Conventions
- Use `camelCase` for variable and function names.
- Use ALL_CAPS for constants.
- Use meaningful and descriptive names.

### Code Structure
- Keep functions and methods short and focused on a single task.  
- Organize code into modules or classes based on functionality.
- Use comments to explain complex logic or decisions.

### Indentation and Spacing
- Maintain consistent indentation (4 spaces per level).
- Use spaces around operators and after commas for better readability.

### Formatting  
- Limit lines to a maximum of 80 characters.
- Use blank lines to separate logical sections of code.
- Place opening braces on the same line as the control statement or function declaration. 

### Error Handling
- Use try-catch blocks for handling exceptions.
- Provide meaningful error messages.
- Clean up resources (like file handles or network connections) in finally blocks.

### Version Control
- Write clear and concise commit messages.

### Documentation
- Document public APIs with clear and concise comments.
- Keep documentation up to date with code changes.
- Use README files to explain the purpose and usage of modules or packages.

### Code Reviews
- Participate actively in code reviews.
- Provide constructive feedback focused on code quality and best practices.
- Be open to feedback and willing to make necessary changes.
